Last Updated: Thursday Mar 12, 1998 at 19:45:25 PST

Welcome to Skunkware for the SVR5 based UnixWare 7

Most of the UnixWare 7 Skunkware packages have been prepared for installation using the pkgadd facility.

To install one of these packages, run the command (as root) : 

    # /usr/sbin/pkgadd -d <download-point>/<package-name>.pkg all
where <package-name> refers to the NAME in the first column below and <download-point> refers to the directory in which the pkg file(s) were downloaded.

The SCO Skunkware UnixWare 7 archives include the following directories :

dist
A directory containing compressed tar archives of pre-compiled ready-to-install binary distributions. These can be installed as root by issuing the following commands: 
    # cd /
    # gzcat /mnt/uw7/dist/foo.tar.gz | tar xvf -
admin
Contains the preview release of SCOadmin for Intranets
audio
A directory containing maplay and timidity, an MPEG audio player and MIDI to WAV converter/player
devtools
Contains pre-built ready-to-install versions of the EGCS GNU C Compiler, GNU binutils, GNU make, Dejagnu, and GNU gdb distributions
editors
Contains the xemacs, elvis and vim editors
fileutil
Findutils and unhqx
java
ACME Labs useful Java class library and applications.
emulators
rxvt 2.20 terminal emulator compiled on UnixWare 7
sco
Miscellaneous shell scripts i find useful
db
AddressBook
interp
libraries
Imli , gd , glib, gtk+, jpeg, png, tiff, Mesa , Xaw3d, xpm, and zlib
mail
archivemail, hypermail, imap 4.1, procmail
net
LLNL xdir, Squid Internet Object Cache, zircon , Count , Apache , freeWAIS-sf , Meta-HTML , http-analyze, irc, PHP/FI, and Mini-SQL
shellutil
Contains gzip/gunzip and both the UNIX and DOS bzip2 binary distributions
textproc
a2ps, groff, ghostscript, texinfo, and teTex
video
x11
x11/apps
AddressBook , AnswerGarden, xdiary, xinvest , xpaint , xquote 1, xrolodex, xwebster
x11/games
xpool , xboing, xgalaga, xmame
x11/graphics
povray, ImageMagick, gnuplot, gimp , transfig , xfig
x11/misc
Mathematical Recreations (256 pseudo-color display only), xfishtank
x11/savers
xautolock, xlockmore, xgrab/xgrabsc
x11/viewers
mgdiff, mpeg_play, xv, xanim, ghostview, xascii and xpdf
x11/winman
AfterStep, fvwm2, fvwm95, WindowMaker and enlightenment as well as some window manager and desktop configuration files i have created (DtwmAddInit.tar.gz, DtwmAddInit.sh, and WmAddInit.tar.gz - see the README there).
x11/xfree86
x11/utils
xmailbox
built
gzip'd tar archives of precompiled distributions ready to install by running the command "make install" as root. These included :
  • GNU Binutils
  • Count access counter
  • Egcs, GNU C Compiler
  • Gdb, GNU debugger
  • Hypermail
  • GNU make
  • MetaHTML
  • Msql, Mini-SQL
  • Php/Fi
Finally, all of the packages and binary distributions for SCO UnixWare 2.x seem to run just fine on UnixWare 7. These are available in /skunkware/uw2/Packages (see the file uw2/CONTENTS).
